Why don't we teach people about the positive impacts of good foods and exercise on the body instead? The second you start demonising food and putting the """"the more you eat the fatter you'll get"""" label on it, the more eating disorders you'll come across and the less healthy people will be. The public don't know how to lose weight properly, most of them will just starve themselves. Assuming this plan works.. People won't be eating well, they'll be eating less and worse. A good diet includes a bit of everything including small doses of sugar, fat and of course, plenty of VARIETY. This is essential to keep everything functioning. Even taking multivitamins in the morning and walking a dog or something on a regular basis can make all the difference in the world to your health. Which will of course have a positive impact on your weight. Another thing is parenting. I know too many kids that won't eat a wide range of certain foods because they 'don't like it', 'it looks gross' or 'the texture makes me gag'. People that let their children substitute water with squash are also risking their child's health. Paracetamol won't fix everything but pain and too many children use it for the wrong reason. Letting your child eat junk food while ill is also idiotic. That needs a big change. You need to be raised into these good habits or very motivated to adopt them. Not everybody is. That's the problem.

Poor Dolphin.. Wonder why

That's funny, I don't see them being ignored. The Jewish people have their holidays, and are able to take them off as legal holidays. In fact, when my kids were in school, their """"holiday"""" play included Hanukkah and Kwanzaa and their REAL meanings, yet left out the true meaning of Christmas. They only correlated Christmas with Santa and Rudolph. You can go to the store and find things for those religions. But, this has been a primarily Judeau-Christian nation. The courts were decorated with The Ten Commandments and our dollars embellished with In God We Trust. What I do see is an all-out assault on Christianity and anything correlating to Christmas as a Christian holiday. Sad that there are people so offended by the birth of Jesus, the savior, but it was foretold that this would happen. Oh, and for the record, I wouldn't file a complaint if a teacher had a Kwanzaa decoration displayed or if Hindu had one displayed. It doesn't offend me that they choose to practice or celebrate their religion and holidays. My celebration shouldn't offend them.
I'm also not sure """"depict"""" is the word you're looking for.

FYI The Real Math (As of June, 4th, 2016) Total Number of Delegates Available = 4763 CURRENT Score Hillary Clinton = 1769 Bernie Sanders = 1501 Total Number of Delegates Required to Clinch the Nomination = 2383 Total Number of Delegates Remaining = 1493 Total Number of Delegates Who Vote on June 4th Through June 14th, 2016 = 930 No Candidate Can Clinch the Nomination Before June 14, 2016 Hillary Clinton Would Need 614 out of 930 Bernie Sanders Would Need 882 out of 930 Total Number of Delegates Who Vote on July 25th, 2016 = 719 (Democratic National Convention) The Nomination Will Be Decided on July 25th, 2016.
